groups.name: Lewisham Brighter Beginnings
groups.whatDoYouDo: Work with NHS/Social workers who refer vulnerable new mums to us.  We then provide them with all items they need for them and their new borns
groups.support: More volunteers/ drivers to deliver aid.  We're a sister charity to GRACE (see below). Could extend this to food boxes if needed too

groups.name: GRACE
groups.basedIn: All Lewisham/ Greenwich (storage units in Leegate)
groups.whatDoYouDo: STORAGE & Sorting hub for other charities & grass root groups. We store essential items needed if you find yourself destitute. The charities come to us for provisions and deliver direct to recipients. In Lewisham & Greenwich to date we have Lewisham Brighter Beginnings (see above), HESTIA- for trafficked individuals, links to all refugee groups and to children/domestically abused/homeless groups.  We would like to extend this offering to any charities involved in distributing to Govt identified vulnerable groups and elderly during COVID.
groups.support: For COVID we want to 1) offer our storage/logistics space & experience to store long-life product. By being a central base we can help coordinate supply of food to as many foodbanks as possible e.g. we can store large lorry load palettes of food from bigger donors e.g. to feed 15,000 with pasta centrally.  Each food bank could then come to us weekly to stock up on what they needed and trade between them using our logistics knowledge (learnt from 5 years of supplying to warehouses across Greece). 2) We are also equipped with all non-food items needed to survive a more severe economic depression e.g. blankets, bedding, candles, clothing boxed by age/season/ gender- we see this need coming within a few months as desititution/domestic/child abuse increases and could be provider to others of essential non-food items e.g. maybe via foodbanks or other dedicated charities e.g. elderly
